titlestmt.titleproper: Commonwealth Fund records, Video Recordings, SG 1, Series 39
A Guide to the Commonwealth Fund records, Video Recordings, SG 1, Series 39 FA1286

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-10-01 04:44:57 UTC.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Commonwealth Fund records, Video Recordings, SG 1, Series 39

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records are open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains video records from the Commonwealth Fund archives.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The Rockefeller Archive Center recognizes that our audiovisual materials may contain problematic language and/or content.

The films, videos, and/or sound in this collection have not been altered in any way. All titles and/or content are illustrative of the creator's original vision. As such, this audiovisual collection may contain discriminatory visual and/or aural content that is representative of racial, gendered, or ableist biases.

Accompanying description, most often with creator or donor-generated language and terminology, has to this point been retained and maintained "as received" by RAC with minimal archivist intervention or augmentation.
We acknowledge these problems and aim to cultivate inclusive representation and equity by reconsidering and enhancing our description of this audiovisual material with current sensibilities.

did.unittitle: If I Don't Live to Be Tomorrow - Hospital Care for People with AIDS

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Digital access copy available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Program includes interviews with New York City health care workers about tending to AIDS patients. Also includes interviews with AIDS patients describing their experiences within the hospital system. A Presentation of the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation. Narrated by Colleen Dewhurst.

did.unittitle: An American Hero: The Story of Congressman John Lewis

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Digital access copy available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Written and directed by Raymond D. Strother, narrated by Brock Peters, with songs by Bettie Mae Fikes.

John Robert Lewis was an American politician and civil rights activist who served in the United States House of Representatives for Georgia's 5th congressional district from 1987 until his death in 2020. He was the chairman of the Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee from 1963 to 1966.

In this video, Lewis discusses his association with Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., the use of nonviolent activism in sit-ins, at the March on Selma, and in regard to specific events, such as the 1963 Birmingham Church bombing. Includes a brief interview with wife Lillian Lewis and a 2000 speech by President Bill Clinton.
